title: Model Application - average rate of change

content.question: ​The electromagnetic force between two particular particles is related to the distance between the particles. This relationship is modeled by the function <math alttext="F"><mi>F</mi></math>, where <math alttext="F open parentheses d close parentheses equals fraction numerator 3.6 over denominator d squared end fraction"><mi>F</mi><mfenced><mi>d</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>3.6</mn><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math> for distance <math alttext="d"><mi>d</mi></math>, measured in centimeters, and force <math alttext="F open parentheses d close parentheses"><mi>F</mi><mfenced><mi>d</mi></mfenced></math>, measured in Newtons. What is the average rate of change, in Newtons per centimeter, in the electromagnetic force if the distance between two particles is increased from <math alttext="2.3"><mn>2.3</mn></math> centimeters to <math alttext="3.1"><mn>3.1</mn></math> centimeters?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
